title: Court ruling on travel ban welcomed, questioned
text: "I don't know what was the basis of how they got around the law, but the law seems pretty clear to me that the President had absolute authority to do what he did," Nunez said by telephone. "The only thing I can say is the 9th Circuit has a well-earned reputation of being a left-wing, maverick court."
summary:
"I don't know what was the basis of how they got around the law, but the law seems pretty clear to me that the President had absolute authority to do what he did," Nunez said by telephone.
"The only thing I can say is the 9th Circuit has a well-earned reputation of being a left-wing, maverick court."
